meanings.sent1: The cat was plump and fluffy.
meanings.sent2: She picked the plump apple from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The plump squirrel looked like it had eaten too many acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks were as plump as ripe peaches.
meanings.sent5: The plump pillow was so soft and inviting.

meanings.definition: To make oneself or something else full and rounded
meanings.sent1: He tried to plump up the cushions on the couch.
meanings.sent2: She plumped the pillows before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent3: The baker plumped the dough to make fluffy bread.
meanings.sent4: The gardener plumped up the flowers with extra water.
meanings.sent5: The chef plumped the raisins by soaking them in water.

meanings.definition: To drop or fall heavily or suddenly
meanings.sent1: The heavy raindrops plumped onto the roof.
meanings.sent2: The sack of potatoes plumped onto the ground.
meanings.sent3: The tired hiker plumped down on the grass.
meanings.sent4: The ripe fruit plumped off the tree with a thud.
meanings.sent5: The book plumped onto the table as she dropped it.
